clinical_study.brief_title: Late Subclinical Cardiovascular Disease in Testicular Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Detection of Late Subclinical Cardiovascular Disease in Testicular Cancer Survivors Exposed to Cisplatin-based Chemotherapy and Bone Marrow Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: Late subclinical cardiovascular disease in testicular cancer survivors exposed to cisplatin-based chemotherapy and bone marrow transplant

detailed_description.textblock: Testicular cancer (TC) is diagnosed in young adult males between 18-39 years old. There are late (≥10 years after treatment) atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) events after cisplatin-based chemotherapy (CBCT) treatment in testicular cancer survivors (TCS), along with heightened rates of hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes mellitus, and metabolic syndrome. Early detection of ASCVD to direct preventive measures in young TCS is an unmet need as these patients typically fall short of traditional 40-45-year age-cut offs for ASCVD screening. ASCVD risk will be evaluated in TCS ≥ 10 years after treatment in three groups: 1)TCS exposed to CBCT, 2)TCS exposed to CBCT and bone marrow transplant (BMT), and 3)TCS cured with surgical resection/surveillance. The focus will be on detecting subclinical atherosclerosis in TCS using blood lipid biomarkers and advanced cardiac CT imaging.

primary_outcome.time_frame: More than 10 years after testicular cancer diagnosis, At recruitment
primary_outcome.description: HDL, LDL, Tg, Cholesterol, Novel Lipid biomarkers using blood draws

primary_outcome.time_frame: More than 10 years after testicular cancer diagnosis, At recruitment
primary_outcome.description: Coronary calcium score, coronary artery anatomy and plaque assessment using CT scans

secondary_outcome.time_frame: More than 10 years after testicular cancer diagnosis, At recruitment
More than 10 years after testicular cancer diagnosis, At recruitment
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of residual serum platinum levels

arm_group.description: TCS cured with surgical resection and surveillance (surgical/surveillance, Arm 1)
TCS treat with one or more lines of cisplatin-based chemotherapy

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cisplatin-based chemotherapy and Bone Marrow Transplant (CBCT/BMT)
arm_group.description: TCS treat with one or more lines of cisplatin-based chemotherapy, and who have undergone bone marrow transplant

intervention.arm_group_label: Cisplatin-based chemotherapy and Bone Marrow Transplant (CBCT/BMT)

intervention.description: Coronary artery assessment via CT scans
intervention.arm_group_label: Cisplatin-based chemotherapy and Bone Marrow Transplant (CBCT/BMT)
Cisplatin-based chemotherapy and Bone Marrow Transplant (CBCT/BMT)

study_pop.textblock: Testicular Cancer Patients who are disease free more than 10 years after diagnosis and treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Patients >18 years of age
- Patients will be recruited only if cancer-free at clinical evaluation time.
- For the cases a confirmed TC diagnosis who received one or more cycles of CBCT-based chemotherapies (CBCT group, Arm 2)
- For the cases with a confirmed TC diagnosis who received one or more cycles of CBCT-based chemotherapies and underwent BMT for relapsed refractory disease (CBCT & BMT group, Arm 3).
- For the comparison cohort, biopsy-proven TC patients who had surgery for or surveillance of their testicular cancer and never received CBCTCBCT or BMT (surgical/surveillance, Arm 1)
Exclusion Criteria
- Prior known myocardial infarction (MI), atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD)
- Significant renal disease (GFR<40)
- Allergy to iodinated contrast
- Antecedent chemotherapy for another primary cancer.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Medical Director of Cardio-Oncology Director of Clinical Research Operations, Krannert Cardiovascular Research
